Authors:
Danushka Sandaruwan Tennakoon, Rajesh JEEWON, Chang-Hsin
Kuo, T. K. Goh, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
Phylogenetic and morphological characterization of
Byssosphaeria macarangae sp. nov., and B. taiwanense sp. nov. from
Macaranga tanarius
Keywords:
2 new species, Dothideomycetes, Macaranga, phylogeny,
taxonomy
Abstract:
Byssosphaeria species were collected from Macaranga
tanarius (Euphorbiaceae) in Shihnong forest area in Chiayi, Taiwan and
subjected to morphological examination and DNA sequence analyses. Two
new taxa, Byssosphaeria macarangae sp. nov and B. taiwanense sp. nov are
herein described. Both species can be distinguished from other
Byssosphaeria species based on distinct size differences in asci,
ascospores and DNA sequence data. A detailed descriptions, micrographs
and phylogenetic data of the new species are provided and
illustrated.
